Experience

ObjetGrafik

2022-Present

Challenge: Joined a team of developers who were transitioning to Vue3 from Vue2

Actions: Dedicated time to learning the VueJs framework

Results:

Verified Transport

2022-Present

Challenge: Build landing page for a growing transport company. Needed to showcase their strengths, testimonials, and ability to get a quick quote.

Actions: A fairly straightforward site build, I opted for a traditional HTML, CSS, and Javascript built page. I’d been wanting to try out TailwindCSS, so I used to as an opportunity to tip my toes into the CSS framework world. The real challenge of this site was creating the quote tool. I used simple javascript for this. Eventually the business wanted to have a more robust user authentication system so that clients could save quotes, review and pay invoices, stay up to date with shipping details. If that were to happen, I would use Laravel for these backend features.

Results:

TaxBuddy

2022-Present

Challenge: I wanted to test out my HTML and TailwindCSS skills by fully recreating the premium templates offered by the TailwindCSS team. I felt that being able to make a convincing clone with all the same features of product designed by a team of professionals would really let me know where I stand as a developer.

Actions: Used VueJs and Tailwind to create the necessary components. I taught myself a lot with this exercise – advanced @click methods to pass different styles to elements. Passing data from arrays to populate onscreen information. Advanced CSS positioning, blurring and shadow effects.

Results: I was able to create a website that is nearly identical to one made by established industry professionals. This really gave me the confidence I needed and served as a reference point for how much I have learned as a developer.

EarthTutor

2021-2022

Challenge: Create a website that serves earth science content in a clean and organized way. Needed to be more that a static site – interactive quizzes and flashcards to increase user engagement.

Actions: I decided to use VueJs so that I could build a SPA that starts small with the flexibility to really grow. I also would be able to leverage the components to quickly reuse them throughout the different topics. Eventually would like to implement authentication so students can save notes and record quiz results.

Results:

SonidoSolar
